info.institution: Department of Psychiatry, University of Würzburg, Füchsleinstr. 15, 97080 Würzburg, Germany
info.occupation: At the 1956 Summer Olympics, Lauer finished fourth in 110 m hurdles and was fifth in decathlon. At the 1958 European Championships, Lauer won the gold in 110 m hurdles. In 1958 Lauer also ran his first world record, being a member of German's 4x100 m relay team, which ran 39.5. In 1959, Lauer ran his second world record (13.2), this time in his main event of 110 m hurdles

At the 1958 European Championships, Lauer won the gold in 110 m hurdles. In 1958 Lauer also ran his first world record, being a member of German's 4x100 m relay team, which ran 39.5. In 1959, Lauer ran his second world record (13.2), this time in his main event of 110 m hurdles in Department of Psychiatry, University of Würzburg, Füchsleinstr. 15, 97080 Würzburg, Germany, and his\her h-index is 17, g-index is 36.
